name: Portuguese Muffins - Bolo Levedo
author: J. Pacheco
summary: These are tasty English muffin-like breads from Titia Teolinda in St Micheal, the Azores. They're baked on a griddle, like pancakes.
directions: In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water with a pinch of the sugar
Set aside to ferment, about 10 minutes
Transfer the yeast mixture to a large bowl, and stir in the sugar, eggs, salt, flour, and milk until the dough comes together
Stir in the melted butter, then turn the dough out onto a floured surface, and knead for about 10 minutes, or until smooth and elastic
Cover dough with a cloth and set aside to rise until doubled in bulk, about 45 minutes
Divide dough into about 15 to 20 pieces, and shape them into flat round cakes about 1/2 inch thick
Place a cloth on the table and dust it with flour
Arrange the cakes on the cloth, allowing space for rising
Allow them to set for 1 1/2 hours
Place the cakes in a heavy ungreased skillet, and cook over low heat
Fry the cakes on each side until golden
